11533222211.content:
As the hunters emerge from the portal, they immediately notice the huge blades of grass all around them.

“What is this, some kinda jungle? Where did that whacky doctor send us this time?” groaned Danny.

“Works for me. More hiding spots,” said Viz, reaching for his sniper rifle on his back. Only… his fingers touched the wooden shaft of a spear.

“Oh what the hell!” Ralph whined, reaching for his own weapon, only to find out he's equipped with a dagger in each hand.

Quentin looked around at his motley crew, noticing each member equipped with a bladed weapon and medieval-style armor instead of their customized guns and exo-suits. Only Atomic was unaffected, which meant little for him since he didn't need weapons or armor anyway. Looking around, he also noticed a green bar at the edge of his vision, right underneath his name. Viz noted it looked the view through his target acquisition goggles, except his head was bare. Quentin could also see green bars next to his comrades, along with a green icon floating above their head. Except for Atomic, who had a black icon floating above his monstrous visage. Well, it will make keeping track of his fellow hunters a bit easier.

Just as he was getting used to this new perspective of the world, a flashing envelope icon floating into view. Quentin tapped it, and Van Micro's shadowy visage emerged.

“Heh heh… welcome to Sword Art Online, my lapdogs!” the mad scientist said through the video channel.

“What the hell, Doc!” Danny yelled at the video window. “Where's our stuff? How are we supposed to hunt anything with these kitchen knives!”

“Don't worry, your equipment is being looked after… you can reclaim it if you get back alive! Hahahaha!” the doctor cackled.

“Enough. Where did you send us? What's this Sword Art Online?” Quentin interrupted.

“It's a popular online game, except you connect using your own cranium instead of a computer. But pay close attention to the name: guns aren't allowed in SWORD Art Online, obviously. You'll have to make due with those bladed weapons that I payed a lot of ingame currency for. Do you have any idea how long it took me to grind to get you that sword in your hands, Danny? So many skeletons-”

“Shut up. What's the target?” Atomic roared.

“Oh right. The reason you're here. Of course. Well, if you die in this game, you die in real life. Scary, right? I put a regen skill on your equipment so you guys won't have to worry about it. But the daughter of a very important person is also trapped in this game, and some very powerful people want her taken out. So, all you have to do is defeat her here, and she'll never wake up over there! Of course, I'm getting paid handsomely-”

“We don't care. Where do we find her?” Petire demanded.

“That would help, wouldn't it?” the quack doctor said, rubbing his chin. The hunters heard him hit a few keystrokes and a player's profile popped into each hunter's view. A young girl's smiling face, framed by long brown hair. She was decked out in white and red armor, and a rapier hung sheathed at her hip. She was at a high level, with a lot of deadly skills. Quentin noticed her character name: Asuna.

“Whoa! What a cutie!” Sharper said.

“Ehh… too skinny for me,” Viz moaned.

“Speaking of size… aren't we a bit small, or are those blades of grass just huge?” Zeke asked.

“Oh yeah! In order to transfer you guys into the game, I had to compress you really small! I wrote the algorithm myself, it's quite-”

“You really are insane! How are we supposed to hunt anything when we're only a few inches tall?!” Viz screamed.

“Use your skills! Welp, I should disconnect before the game notices this outside connection. Toodeloo!” the insane scientist said, as the window closed.

Quentin turned to his robotic ally, Beta. The android's hacking capabilities could come in handy in an online game like this.

“Beta, can you find this target?”

“Searching now, Master Quentin… Target acquired. She's currently on this level, staying at an inn in a town close by,” the robot reported.

“Hey Slick, just teleport us there! Er… Slick?” Ralph said, poking at the snoozing telepath.

“No can do… it'll be a while before his skills recharge enough for him to teleport us anywhere,” Quentin concluded.

Zeke examined his spear. “Taking down even the weakest monster will be a challenge at this size. Beta, can you perhaps hack the game to remove the target from the player list, so it will look as if she was killed?”

“It is possible, but only if the target was rendered unconscious first. The game's security layer is simply too secure otherwise.”

Quentin slammed his fist down into his open palm. “That's the plan, then. We ambush the target and render her unconscious, then we remove her character from the game's roster. Then we'll get the hell out of here,” the young leader said.

“Sounds good to me. What's the plan?” Petire inquired.

“Well...”
11533222211.title: Tiny Hunters Online

115332222112.content:
“Let's lure her to us. We have more than enough space to play with out here in this field,” Quentin said.

“Yeah… if we don't get eaten by a monster first,” Viz whined.

“Beta, send a message to the target. Make it say that you're being attacked by a huge monster and you need help. Also, make it look like it was sent by some weakling player,” Quentin told his robotic comrade.

“Sending now,” Beta said, his hands quickly tapping out a message in the air.

“No way… you aren't planning on getting into a fight with a monster at our size, do you?” Sharper gasped.

“Open your eyes, kid. We got a monster right here,” Zeke said, slapping Atomic on the back.

“Hey, I got feelings to, ya know!” Atomic laughed.

“You got it. Execute plan Delta! Everyone, get ready!” the young Drangua ordered.

Later…

From their perch atop the highest tree branch, the three recon stooges were the first ones to see the target approaching. The young girl certainly didn't waste any time getting here. The target's long brown hair streamed behind her as she ran to the coordinates sent in the message. Sunlight glinted off her armor as she ran through the field at full steam.

“She must be quite the do-gooder to come running out here so quickly,” observed Ralph. “How revolting.”

“She's even cuter in person! What a goddess!” Sharper drooled.

Petire knocked both of their heads together. “Stay quiet, and wait for the signal!” the bald-headed hunter said.

Just like Ralph said, Asuna wasted no time coming to the rescue. She remembered how scared she was when she was a weak player, always afraid of death lurking right around the corner. She didn't think twice, quickly donning her armor and running to where the player said he was cornered by a monster. However, as she got closer, she couldn't believe her eyes. It looked like an action figure was fighting against a monster the size of a small dog. Still, the monster had a black icon hovering over its bulk, telling her this was a seriously strong monster. Even at her high level, there was still dangerous beasts roaming about. The player fighting the monster was fending off its attacks, but looked like he was giving a bit of ground with each parry. But why was he so tiny? Was this a glitch in the system, or a new status effect? Also, he looked strange. Maybe a custom avatar? Whatever, she could ask him once she defeated the beast. The monster was terrifyingly muscular and demonic. Asuna would have to be on her toes to defeat this creature. She equipped her rapier and prepared to attack.

“Watch it, Atomic! This is supposed to be a fake battle!” Quentin yelled, just barely avoiding another one of his invincible comrade's swipes.

“I wanna make it look realistic! Better keep up!” Atomic roared with a laugh. They both turned as they heard thundering footsteps approach. Their target came into view, sword in hand.

“Hey there! Don't worry, I'll defeat this monster in a jiffy!” Asuna said, getting into an attack stance.

“Ooh! She has the voice of an angel!” Sharper drooled. “Do we really have to do this?”

“Just follow orders, dammit!” Petire said.

“Linear!” Asuna shouted, as her body began to glow. Before anyone could blink, she lunged forward at an incredible speed, rapier pointed directly at Atomic. For anyone else, they would be impaled before they could even draw another breath. But Atomic's reflexes were unparalleled. From his view, the sword looked like the pointy end of a skyscraper was headed directly at him. His world exploded in pain as the sword entered his body, but just as quickly, his arms wrapped around the blade of the rapier. He planted his feet, and kept the rapier stuck inside his body. He watched his own HP display dip briefly, before his invincibility kicked in and his HP filled back up. Using his incredible strength, he wrenched the sword away from the giantess's grip. Shocked, the Lightning Flash began to stumble. She had never seen a monster parry an attack so with such speed!

“Alright! Finish this quickly, because this hurts like hell!” Atomic roared.

“Now!” Quentin ordered. Asuna was so confused over being disarmed that she didn't even notice the three tiny recon stooges drop from the tree above her. Brandishing their weapons, the three hunters jumped into Asuna's thick curtain of hair and plunge their swords and knives right between the target's shoulder blades. Their weight caused them to drag their weapons right down the giantess's back, and they landed on the ground right between her armored feet. Sharper began to looked up Asuna's skirt before Petire dragged him away, before they could be stepped on.

Asuna doubled over in pain. The attack didn't do much damage, but she was now fighting multiple unknown enemies without a weapon. Quentin noticed the icons over the hunters' heads now turned orange. Asuna noticed this change as well, and wondered why their was tiny player-killers running around. Is this a new trick by Laughing Coffin? Whatever she case, she had to defeat these Pkers and warn other players. Tiny infiltrators would be a menace, for any guild.

As she opened her inventory menu to equip a backup sword, she failed to notice three more tiny hunters rush from the grass towards her feet. Before she could finish the equipment change, Zeke, Viz and Danny sliced into the giantess's ankle, causing another glowing red wound on her avatar. Asuna saw a dreaded icon appear under her HP display: a boot with a red line through it. Limited mobility means certain death, especially since she's alone. Her knees buckled under her as she toppled forward, but she caught her fall with her hands. She looked up to see the tiny Quentin with a smirk on his face, readying his broadsword for a final attack.
115332222112.title: Asuna the Lightning Splash

choices: Asuna regains conscious and begins counterattack!
The hunters found a place to go
1153322221121.content:
As the young Drangua ready himself for the final blow, he check to make sure Atomic is alright...He did get pierce by a rapier: A giant size one that is and this is the first time he was in pain which is very very rare due to his metallic skin.

"You alright, Atomic?"

"Argh...Yeah yeah, just hurry up." Atomic winched when he pulled the rapier out of his body, throws it down beside him.

"Alright then. Remember: We do have regan skills, thanks to our crazy scientist...Speaking of crazy, where's Dr.Coon and the others?"

"I have yet to receive any info from, but they are in this game." Beta informs.

"That's good. Well then... Back to business." Quentin walks over to the downed Asuna, still couldn't believe she was taken down by a group of tiny PKers and a monster who works for them! With the limited mobility still in place and weaponless, it looks like it may be the end for her...

"Nothing personal, Miss Asuna. We are just following orders...By being guinea pigs." Quentin sighs

"Who... Who are you?! Are you with Laughing Coffin!?" Asuna yelled at the tiny hunters, demanding to know who are they. To the hunters her voice was quite earth rattling to some hunters, but Sharper doesn't mind... He just in love with the beautiful Asuna.

"Laughing Coffin...?" Ralph said. He and the others look at Beta for some info.

"Unfortunately, I do not have any data on this Laughing Coffin. I shall recover it once we dealt with this."

"Very well." Quentin turns to Asuna with his broadsword ready. "Actually...We are the NanoCorps: famous group of bounty hunters known for 100% success of completing the missions and I, Quentin Andross, is the one who lead the mischief group. We were just hired by a...'friendly' scientist who want us to hunt down targets...namely females...So, no hard feelings, we are just doing our job." Quentin open his skills menu, viewing which one has the 'knockout' status...He then notice a very familiar skill that he uses before he enter this portal: Dreaded Dragon Claw

"That should do it." The young Drangua active the skill, his sword along with his hand, covered in dragon scales. The tiny hunters jumps in the air, high above the Lightening Flash face and landed a serious blow against Asuna's forehead. "Forgive me. You will reawaken a few hours."

The hunters watches Asuna's avatar losing conscious before falling to the ground with a massive thud, Quentin landed besides his fellow hunters with a slight grin on his face.

"Well that's that...Shall we begin Beta?"

"Yes, Master Quentin. However, we must move our target somewhere that no one will see her body."

"Uhh...This is a MMO trap game? No way we will find a unoccupied area." Danny said.

"Plus, monsters will be everywhere...What's the plan, Zeke?"

"First of all, we need to carry Asuna. That's your job, Atomic." The wise gunman orders Atomic.

"No problem!" Atomic roared.

"Next, we need to figure where should we go...someone get a map out." The hunters gather around with a map place, checking each region and terrains they could go...
1153322221121.title: Down goes the Lightning Flash

1153322221122.content:
The broadsword had just the right heft in Quentin’s hands as he prepared to strike the finishing blow. With his quarry down on her hands and knees, it didn’t feel much like a hunt. He remembered the heat from the Quantum Dragon’s belly as he sliced the creature in two during his first bounty on the eighth moon around Regolith IV. His skin crawled as he recalled the slimy flesh of the Plutonium Squid deep in the Endless Ocean on Europa that had taken out a whole platoon of the galaxy’s best bounty hunters before Quentin shoved a nuke through its maw. But this target, as huge as she was, was still a cute young girl. Under a dangling fringe of brown hair, her brown eyes still blazed with fire, calling to mind the old saying that a cornered animal is always the most dangerous. Oh well, he just wanted this job to be over with. His fellow hunters had done all the dirty work of disabling the target, and all that was left was for their fearless leader to knock her out. He flipped his blade over to its flat side, in order to deliver a powerful thwack.

The Drangua’s calf muscles bulged as he prepared to launch himself at Asuna. The ground cracked under his feet as he leapt skyward, toward’s Asuna’s heavenly face.

“Rising Tiger Strike!” he yelled, as Asuna’s face loomed in the sky above him, coming ever closer like a falling planetary body. “Asuna the Lightning Flash… hmph, what a joke,” the Drangua laughed. “You don’t look so quick to me!” he shouted up at his quarry.

For her part, the brown-haired swordswoman was about to live up to her nickname. Shifting her weight to her left side, she reached out with her right hand, intending to intercept the tiny Pker in midair. Of course, with his extremely high reflexes, Quentin saw the hand coming from a mile away, fingers outstretched like talons. He immediately went to activate his jet-boots, and… oh wait, those were left behind when he was sucked into this ridiculous game. Certainly Slick can teleport him away and… he’s still snoozing. No matter. Quentin always had his handy dragon wings ready to pop out at a moment’s notice. He disliked using them too often, as they always made a mess of his clothes, but this was a dangerous situation. He squeezed his back muscles, and before his wings could sprout out, a video message appeared before his eyes. Dr. Van Micro’s shadowy visage appeared in the window.

“The hell do you want, Doc? I’m a little busy right now!” Quentin fumed.

“Just to let you know, flying has not been implemented in this game! If you want to soar through the skies, you’ll have to play this game’s successor. In fact-” the crazy scientist blathered before Quentin tapped the window closed in a rage. With no way to alter his trajectory, the hunter was helpless to evade as Asuna’s hand grabbed him. He slammed into the skin of her palm hard enough to knock the wind out of him. Her slender fingers closed around him in a vice-like grip, crushing his lungs. His head and shoulders still poked out, however, and he quickly swung his sword around to sever the offending appendage. He still had the flat side of the sword facing her, however, and he silently cursed himself as the broadsword bounced off her wrist with a resounding thud.

Asuna winced in pain, but quickly pivoted her weight onto her left hand and kicked out with her uninjured leg in a sweep, sending the hunters gathered around her feet flying into the weeds. Sharper just happened to be ducking to retie his shoe, and he got a heavenly glimpse of Asuna’s panties in full view underneath her red skirt. Momentarily out of danger, the swordswoman collapsed down onto her butt, crushing Sharper underneath. The soft material of the giantess’s panties did nothing to cushion the blow, and Sharper’s HP quickly fell to 0 as her massive weight crushed him into the dirt. Because of the doc’s machinations, he still remained in the game, but his HP couldn’t recover while the giant girl’s rear remained on top of him. But in all his travels, there was nowhere he would rather be more, then under the rear of the girl he just fell in love with.

Before Quentin could strike another blow, Asuna’s left hand hovered over his head and two slender fingers roughly pinched his wrists together, then plucked his sword from his grip and threw it away. Now disarmed as well, the Drangua looked in dismay at the icon of a sword with a slash through it right under his HP bar. Oh well. He wasn’t the only member of this bounty hunter company. Quentin looked around from his elevated view, but could only see Atomic still impaled by Asuna’s sword. That was a bit of a stalemate, as removing the sword from his body would allow Atomic full movement, but would give the swordswoman back her weapon, which might spell doom for the hunters, now that she’s more familiar with their tactics. Certainly Zeke was planning their next move, hidden in the tall grass with the rest of his fellow hunters. Except Sharper, of course.

With little else to do, Quentin took stock of his captor. His heightened sense of smell was filled with the tangy bite of Asuna’s sweat, but he could also detect faint traces of vanilla. He met her piercing brown eyes with his own gaze. Long caramel-colored hair cascaded down around her flawless face. Her clothes were impeccably tailored, and flattered her form. Like Viz, she was a bit too skinny for Quentin, but he was instead attracted to her fierce fighting spirit. Even backed into a corner by highly-skilled adversaries, she was still giving it everything she’s got. As someone who has had his share of scrapes with death, the Drangua knew that look in her eyes: the look of someone who would never give up, no matter what. It’s a shame she had to be his target. He would love to fight alongside her someday.

“Listen up!” Asuna yelled, projecting her voice towards the hidden hunters. “Throw down your weapons and surrender, or...” she said, two fingers of her other hand reaching down and squeezing Quentin’s head. “Or I’ll kill your leader!”

Despite the crushing cranial pressure, Quentin’s ears still worked well enough to hear peals of mocking laughter coming from the grass. “Go ahead, do it!” Danny said. “He still hasn’t given us our pay from the last two jobs!”

“Hey, I’ve been meaning to! I just haven’t gotten around to balancing the checkbook yet!” Quentin choked out.

“He deserves it!” mocked Ralph. “He always cooks the worst food, too!”

“And he never wants to do the laundry!” came another voice.

“And he snores!” said another, followed by roars of laughter from the hidden hunters.

“You useless...” hissed Quentin. “When this is over, you’re all fired!”

The crushing pressure finally let up as Asuna stopped pinching Quentin’s skull. “Being a leader is tough, huh?” she said to him, knowingly.

“You’re telling me! They never want to wake up early, or do any recon on the target, or take out the trash!” the hunter’s leader complained. He could tell immediately that Asuna was one of those born leaders, that people would follow to the very pits of hell. Just like himself. But this is no time to be making friends with his target! Quentin might’ve been new to this game, but he quickly figured out Asuna’s strategy: by stalling for time until her HP recovered and her aliments went away, she would be able to escape. If she hid somewhere or summoned help, this job would quickly become impossible. Quentin had never lost a target yet, but he’ll need his fellow hunters’ help more than usual on this job…
1153322221122.title: Intercepted

11533222211222.content:
Sneaking through the grass, Zeke finally found Beta. The robot was wracking his silicon brain, trying to think of a plan to save his master. However, Zeke had something wild in mind.

“Beta, can you hack into Asuna’s inventory?” the co-leader asked.

“Hacking now,” Beta said, windows popping in and out of existence as he tried to hack into Asuna’s profile.

“What’re you thinking?” Petire asked, coming up to the group. The rest of the hunters followed closely behind him.

“Well, if we can add a poisonous item to the target’s inventory, we might be able to make her sick. Or… a bomb would damage her...” Zeke contemplated, rubbing his chin.

“Displaying target’s inventory… now,” Beta announced. Asuna’s armor and clothing were displayed in a window, along with her items.

“Hey, what does that button do?” Danny said, tapping at a random button at the bottom of the window. The button glowed, and all of Asuna’s equipment was now added to her inventory.

“That… de-equips everything on the target,” Beta explained.

“Ooh… snap,” Danny said, as Zeke glared daggers at him.

…

“But still… it’s nice to have friends, isn’t it?” Asuna said, starting to bond with the tiny Drangua in her hand. He wasn’t the usual Pker scum. She felt a bit of a bond with him, as a fellow warrior. However, she noticed that her HP had recovered enough to remove her movement disability. Finally, she could make tracks. Before she could move, however, her armor and clothes began to glow with a blue light… before disappearing entirely. The giantess was now as naked as the day she was born. Gasping in embarrassment and rage, she balled her hands into fists. Unfortunately for one Drangua, however, he currently occupied one fist, and his eyeballs nearly popped out of his skull, both from the pressure and the incredible view in front of him. Asuna’s porcelain skin glistened in the sunlight, her hair covering her breasts.

“You bastards! What did you do?! You’re gonna pay for this!” Asuna roared, standing up. The pressure on him now released, Sharper rolled onto his back, only to be greeted with the greatest sight of his life: the backside of the girl he fell in love with, now completely bare.

Asuna was overcome with rage. First they attack her like cowards, now they figured out a way to remove all her clothes. People or not, she wouldn’t stop until they were all dead. First one up, however, is their leader, still helpless in her hand. Brushing aside any thoughts of camaraderie she once had with the young Drangua, she opened her lips and raised Quentin to her mouth. The target’s once-angelic face was now creased with anger, as she brought him closer to her lips. How convenient, his head was the perfect size to fit between her teeth like a piece of candy. Quentin saw a strand of saliva break into droplets between the giantess’s pink lips as her hot breath washed over him. He could see her muscular tongue ready to strike like the Beast Anaconda from The Jungle Planet, the wettest, slimiest creature Quentin had ever faced. Until now, that is. The back of Asuna’s throat led to a deep abyss, but there would be no climbing out of that crevasse. Quentin’s head was placed on a glistening white tooth, as the giantess placed him into her mouth like a large lollipop. Except this lollipop had an extra-juicy center. The cavernous maw quickly darkened as Asuna’s lips closed. Her top row of teeth slammed down on Quentin’s neck, severing it. He watched his HP bar plunge to 0, but his vision never went completely dark. Looks like the crazy doc’s modifications made him unable to die even if decapitated. Still, it looks like he’ll be out of this fight.

A stream of digital blood dribbled down Asuna’s chin as she pulled Quentin’s headless torso out of her mouth with a grin. She tossed the body into the grass before wiping her chin with the back of her hand. “Looks like your boss lost his head...” she cackled. “But don’t worry. Soon you’ll join him!”

“Target approaching,” Beta said, as the giant naked girl stomped toward them.

“No shit!” Petire said.

“Ah… my bad?” Danny offered, before Zeke punched him hard enough to pound him into the dirt. Asuna’s fist crashed into the group, sending Danny even further into the ground and sending the rest of the hunters flying through the air like shrapnel. They could barely stand up before the giantess sundered them again with her bare hands and feet.

“Why… won’t…. you… die!” she said through her teeth, unaware of the tiny hunter’s invulnerability. Still, she continued to stomp and punch them mercilessly. Despite their HP reaching 0 multiple times, each hunter continued to stand up, only to be thrown into the air again. “Maybe being unable to die isn’t so great,” Viz grumbled, as Asuna squashed him flat under her sole for the umpteenth time. By now, bits of digital blood trickled down from between her toes.

Awoken by all the commotion, Slick let out a mighty yawn. The telepath was utterly unfazed by the sight of a giant naked girl stomping his comrades into oblivion. It was only when Danny flew through the air and landed next to him that he decided to act. Figuring the rampaging giantess was their current target, Slick levitated a large rock and tossed it into Asuna’s head. The swordswoman’s eyes rolled backward and she fell onto her back, out cold. Satisfied, Slick fell back asleep.

Zeke was just recovering from being crushed in Asuna’s fist before her shadow fell over him. Expecting to see the dirty sole of her foot, he was inside surprised to see her toppling over like a fallen tree. He just managed to roll away as she collapsed onto the ground, throwing up clouds of dust. Brushing off his hat, he was delighted to see that Asuna’s eyes were tightly closed. They can feel safe, for a little while. Sharper had already climbed onto the giantess’s body, and was currently spread eagle on her flat stomach, rising and falling with every breath. His eyes had hearts in them as he rubbed his cheek against Asuna’s milky-white skin. Atomic finally pulled the sword out of his body, and threw it aside with a clang. “I’ll be feeling that one tomorrow,” he roared.

“I’m glad that’s over with,” Viz said, making sure his arms were still attached.

“Agreed. But we’ve got one more problem to take care of,” Zeke said, gesturing towards Quentin’s headless body. “Someone has to retrieve the boss’s melon from that girl before we can get out of here.”

“And who will get that thankless job?” Petire asked, already knowing the answer.

“You’re up, Recon Squad,” ordered the co-leader.

“Always the best jobs,” Petire mumbled, grabbing Ralph and walking towards the fallen giantess’s head. They grabbed fistfuls of her soft brown hair, and began climbing up her scalp. When they arrived at her forehead, they paused to admire the view. Asuna’s nose rose gently upward before them, and her closed eyes were ringed by long eyelashes. The small hills of her breasts sloped downward into the plain of her stomach, and her long legs seemed to stretch to the horizon. They could see Sharper having the time of his life, rolling around like a child on Asuna’s tummy. As they approached the target’s lips, they were buffeted by a warm wind blowing from the giantess’s nostrils.

“Hey, this is messing up by hair,” complained Ralph.

Petire rubbed his own smooth noggin. “Not my problem.”
11533222211222.title: KO

115332222112222.content:
The two recon stooges gently put their hands on Asuna’s plump lips and began to pry them apart, exposing her white teeth and a dark cavern beyond.

“Boss, you in here?” Ralph yelled into the organic cave.

“Idiot, his lungs are in his body, how would he be able to respond?” Petire said, exasperated.

As Ralph got ready to descend, he hit his head off of an incisor. “Oww!”

“Hey Beta, can you make us a bit smaller?” Petire shouted down at the robot.

“Changing avatar parameters… now,” Beta said. The two recon goons began shrinking, until they were the size of one of Asuna’s ivory teeth.

“That’s too small! We’ll never be able to climb out now!” Ralph moaned.

“Not to worry!” Atomic roared, grabbing Asuna’s head and moving it to a more vertical position. “You can just walk inside now!”

“Geez, thanks,” Petire said, climbing over the bottom lip and onto the tongue. The walls and floor were covered in shiny saliva, and the sharp teeth formed a sharp ring all around the tinier hunters. Asuna’s tongue squished under their feet as they looked around for Quentin’s noggin.

“Maybe she ate ‘im,” Ralph said, his voice echoing off the walls.

“Maybe not. Keep looking,” answered Petire, climbing over Asuna’s molars and descending into the space between her gums and cheek. The humidity was overwhelming, and a drop of saliva splashed onto Petire’s smooth head. He was just about to try lifting up the giantess’s tongue and checking underneath when he kicked something in the darkness. Something round. Petire dislodged it from between Asuna’s back molars and her cheek, and the scaly texture told him it was Quentin’s separated head. The Drangua rolled his eyes at being stuck in his dark cavern for so long.

“I found the boss’s melon. Hey, what are you playing with?” Petire inquired, noticing Ralph walking towards the back of Asuna’s throat.

“Look at this thing! It’s like a punching bag!” Ralph said, giving the dangling uvula a playful nudge. The fleshy ball bounced around.

“Haha! Hey, bet I can hit it with the boss’s head!” Petire said, launching the head at the pink ball of flesh. The uvula slapped Quentin’s noggin right back at the bald hunter.

Ralph jumped onto the swinging uvula. “I feel just like Tarzan!” he laughed, swinging back and forth. “Hey, toss me the boss’s head! I wanna make a lay-up!”

Suddenly, a rumbling vibration came from deep within Asuna….
115332222112222.title: Scavenger Hunt

1153322221122221.content:
From his perch on Asuna’s uvula, Ralph could hear a deep gurgling roiling up from the yawning chasm below. The organic chamber of the giantess’s mouth began to shake with a fierce intensity.

“Okay, playtime’s over!” Petire shouted, not wanting to become this girl’s next meal. “Let’s get out of here!”

Before he could get very far, however, the bald hunter’s ankle twisted and he fell awkwardly into the moist tongue. The spongy flesh yielded under his muscular form, and rows of small bumps tickled his chin. Petire shuddered as he realized that the giant girl was unconsciously tasting him. Ralph gripped the uvula’s cord for dear life, but a fierce wind erupted from the throat and tossed him like a rag doll. The explosive cough knocked him into Petire, and the two hunters rolled across the tongue towards the light streaming in from the front of the mouth. A fortunate buck of the tongue prevented the hunters from being dashed to ribbons on the girl’s monolithic teeth, and the two goofballs were launched out of the mouth. To the hunters, it felt like being blasted out of a cannon, but to Asuna it was just a simple reflexive action to an annoying tickle in her throat.

Petire and Ralph finally roll to a stop near Asuna’s navel. “Oh, hey guys,” Sharper greeted them. “Hmm, were you two always so short?” he asked, as the two hunters slowly got to their feet.

“It’s a long story,” Petire said, wiping the slimy saliva off his bald noggin. He looked past the twin hills of Asuna’s breasts to see her eyes still closed, and her head gently settling back down. Good, she didn’t wake up. An explosion of giggling laughter drew his attention. Ralph had fallen into the giantess’s navel and was currently bouncing off the walls like a child in a ball pit.

“You guys have gotta try this!” Ralph laughed. “It’s like a bouncy castle!”

“Why didn’t I think of that?” Sharper mused, before jumping in the belly button.

“Get out of there!” Petire yelled down at them. “We got what we came for, so let’s go!”

…

“Beta, can you hack into the player database now?” Zeke asked, hoping the fearsome giantess will stay asleep long enough to pull this off.

“Hacking now… 1%… 2%...” the robot counted up, as hacking windows flickered into and out of existence. Danny had gathered Quentin’s headless body and Petire screwed the drangua’s melon back onto his neck.

“Just like screwing on a light bulb. Hey boss, you home?” Danny asked, snapping his fingers in front of the young leader’s eyes.

“Stop that, or I’ll bite them off,” the irritated drangua snapped.

“Yep, back to normal,” Viz observed.

“So, what was it like in there?” Atomic asked, placing Asuna’s head gently back onto the ground. “I’ve eaten lots of things, but I’ve never been eaten myself!”

“Wet and way too warm, like a sauna on full blast. Anyway, what’s our status?” Quentin asked.

“Hacking into the target’s profile,” Beta reported. “Deleting profile… now. Target has been removed from the game.”

“Excellent,” Quentin said, before a chat window appeared before him. Van Micro’s insane face popped into view.

“Mission accomplished! I’ve just received word that the target has disappeared from the roster. Really, I didn’t think you could kill her, but then again, you guys haven’t failed a mission yet!” the mad scientist cackled. “My associates are in place outside the hospital to confirm her death. I’ve placed a teleport stone in your inventories, so you can come back whenever you’re ready!”

Quentin clicked the message window closed. “Hey, won’t he be pissed when he figures out we didn’t actually kill her?” Petire said, jerking a thumb over towards the giantess, who continued to snooze peacefully.

“We’ll collect our payment and hightail it before that happens,” Quentin said. “By the way, Beta, what will happen to her?”

“The target has been converted to an item, so she cannot be further harmed. She will wake up in the real world when the game is over, along with the surviving players,” the robot said.

“Hey, we’re not going to leave her out here like this, right?” Sharper said. “She could still be kidnapped, or something.”

“Good point. Beta, did you happen to copy down the target’s friend list?” Quentin asked.

“Affirmative, Master Quentin.”

“Then send a message asking for help to one of those people. I don’t care which one. Tell them to come quick, too.”

“Sending now, Master Quentin.”

…

The tiny hunters hid in the tall grass as another set of giant footprints approached the clearing. They looked up to see a pink-haired girl tromp towards them. A splash of freckles adorned her friendly face.

“Geez, this must’ve been one tough monster if you need me to repair your armor again,” Lisbeth said.

“Of course, you’re lucky I was in town and had nothing else to do-- what the heck?!” she gasped, as she came across Asuna’s naked, sleeping form.

“What are you, an exhibitionist? Good think Kirito didn’t see you like this, he’d die from a fatal nosebleed!” the blacksmith said, trying to shake her friend awake.

“Wow, you’re really out cold. I better get you out of here before someone nasty finds you,” Lisbeth said, dropping a cloak from her inventory and draping it over Asuna’s slender body. The pink-haired girl then placed a hand on her friend’s shoulder before using a teleport stone to whisk them both away.

Quentin breathed a sigh of relief. Asuna might have been his target, but he still felt glad that she was in good hands. “Let’s get out of here,” the leader said, selecting the teleport stone from his inventory. He was bathed in blue light, and found himself back in the field from which they had entered the portal originally. His fellow hunters rematerialized next to him. Their equipment was in a pile at the base of a tree, along with their high-tech armor.

“Our stuff! Oh, how I’ve missed thee!” Danny said, kissing his favorite pistol.

“No way, this isn’t right,” Ralph said, holding up an oversized exo-suit. “This is way too big!”

“It’s not the suit, buddy,” Viz said.

“You’re just tiny!” Zeke laughed.

“What’re you… oh shit!” Petire said, realizing that Beta had never returned Ralph and himself to “normal” size after their expedition into Asuna’s mouth. Both hunters were now head-and-shoulders shorter than normal.

“Don’t worry, I’m sure Dr. Van Micro can fix you… for a price!” Danny laughed.

“Good work, guys. To the next adventure!” Quentin said, walking towards the setting sun.

11533222213221.content:
As the hunters emerges from the portal, they take notice of the their surrounding area...Behind them is a patch of grass with gleaming water droplet, only it's ten times bigger than them. A large tree beside them is quite gigantic compare to the hunters, Sharper notice a single leaf near them is huge as well...meaning the shrunken part of the device actually works.

"That blasted doc's device does work! Even the shrunken part..." Petire groans.

"That's not the only worst part. Look at our weapons." Ralph pointed at Zeke's weapon which is usually his favorite sniper rifle on his back...Now it's only a large bladed sword. They also notice they are wearing a medieval style armors instead of exo-suits.

"What the...?" Zeke picks up his new weapon in surprise. "...Where's 'Ol Bestie?"

"Uh-oh...I think the doc replaces our guns and suits with swords and such. Also, notice something above our heads?" Quentin pointed a green bar with his name just above him. It seems every hunters has the same green bar except for Atomic as his bar is actually a black icon with monster like image.

"Hmm...It looks like we are in a video game, I recognize Atomic's icon...I believe he's a monster in this game, typical." Danny said while chuckling.

"Hey! I have feelings ya know," Atomic laughs

As the hunters getting used to their new location, a flashing envelope icon floating into their view. Quentin slowly tapped it, and the crazy laughing scientist image emerged.

"Mwhahahaha! I hope you like your new looks, my hunters! Welcome to Sword Art Online!" Dr. Micro laughs through the video channel.

"Can it, doc! Where's our stuff!?" Danny shouted at the doctor.

"Oh yes, there are with me safe and sound, you'll get them back once you are done with the mission...If you survive that is..." The doctor laughs once more.

"Ugh...By the way, what is Sword Art Online?" Quentin asked him.

"It's a popular online game, except you connect using your own cranium instead of a computer and of course, guns are banned in this game hence the word 'SWORD' Art Online, meaning no guns for you! However, I manage your equipment and given you...Legendary, all enhanced weapons and armor. Sure they do look normal but I had to take extra measures... Atomic, however, is a different story. I had to make him a....'Legendary' monster since he's not human....You know how hard it is to get this equipment ready, I mean, I pour my soul into-"

"Yeah yeah, just tell us who's our target." the sloth said while yawning.

"Oh right..." The doctor types in the target's name and sends a player's profile to the hunters' view. The target is a beautiful elf like woman with glossy, dark green hair so dark that it is nearly black hanging down her back. Wearing a Japanese-style clothing and a katana that hangs from her obi and her feet clad in high crimson clogs. She is high level and acquire lots of dangerous skills and techniques. Quentin sees the player's name: Sakuya or Lady Sakyua

"Well hello, hot and good looking!" Danny said.

"Busty too...I'm liking her." Sharper said

"Hrmm...It says here she's quite a formidable opponent in the Sylph dueling tournaments. Though I'm not a complainer type, but how do we take her down while we are a size of an ant?" said the new member Ryx.

"Use your skills, hunters! I mean you are the great and invincible hunters, yes?"

"Well yes, but..."

"There you go! Now onward, my hunters! And make sure I see the head of the pretty Sylph...Oh yes! There's one more thing I must tell you. Now this is really a life and death game...Meaning, if you die in this game, you died in real life."

"WHAT!?!" The hunters shouted in shocked.

"H-However! I did a little illegal intrusion...I added all you hunters a passive skill know as 'Immortal'. It'll regain your health when the bar reaches zero. That'll make sure you won't die in the game...And with that over with, I'm out! Good luck hunters!" The doctor laughs before closing the window.

Quentin turns to Beta since he's a robot with amazing hacking abilities which could be useful in the game.

"...Can you override the game's security and tried to remove her name from the player as if we killed? We don't really want to kill her in real life...She might be a young little girl..."

"Yes, It shouldn't be too much difficult, Master Quentin. Also, I located our target...She is in a nearby town not too far from here. It seems she is held up in a meeting."

"Excellent! Then we should teleport in town and..." Quentin notice Slick is sleeping on the job once again. "...Never mind..."

"We could head over there or lure her into the field...Either one should do quite nicely." said Zeke. "Although...Atomic's a monster so he's not getting inside the town."

"Really? That sucks..." Atomic grumbles.

"So, how should we proceed?" Another new member, Dr. Coon said.

Quentin thinks about the plans about a minute or so until he figure it out, he decided to go with...
11533222213221.title: Targeting the Lady Sylph

choices: Sakuya grabs Quentin and begins counterattack
A familiar female ally appears and saw Sakuya on the ground
115332222132212.content:
"Guess we have to do the old fashion way." Quentin said.

"Ahh hell, not the bait and wait crap again..." Atomic groans.

"Sorry, Atomic. We don't wanna cause panic in this game, so this plan is the better choice, plus I already got a plan that you may like, Atomic."

"Hmm...I'm all ears. Let's hear it."

"Alright. Gather round, hunters. Here's the plan: We will send a help message to Sakuya, acting as a low level player being attack by a very powerful monster a.k.a Atomic."

"Interesting...Who's the low level player?" Petire asked.

"That will be...Ryx. You'll be the bait." Quentin looks at the blind swordsman.

"...Alright. I'll sheathe my sword in order not to burn up Atomic..."

Gihaha! I still remember that burns...But yeah, keep it intact."

"The rest of us will hid among the grass and tree above us. Once our target comes and begins attacking Atomic, Ryx will unsheathe his sword and try to cut her knees, so she'll lose mobility. Once she's down, we will strike her with everything we got...Though this is gonna be different since guns aren't allow, we gonna have to do this up close and personal...Any questions?"

"Just one: What if she will call reinforcement?" said Dr. Coon

"Depending how many it is. If it's more than two...We retreat until we come up with another plan."

"We do need Slick in order to retreat...So, keep him awake." said Zeke.

"Easier said than done, Zeke. That fool won't wake up during a massive earthquake or a loud explosion. We're gonna need a medicine treament...Right, Coon?" Danny looks at the doctor.

"Hrmm...I'll think of something while we wait. I didn't bring much ingredients but I'll see what I can make of."

"Beta, send a message to the target. Make sure it sound like a weak player."

"Sending the message..." Beta quickly tapping out a message in the air and sends it to Sakuya. "Message sent."

"Excellent! Get in places, guys. This could be a worthwhile..." Quentin ordered his team.

----------------------------------------------------------

Inside the jungle of a grass, the three recon, Dr. Coon and Danny ready themselves and waiting for their target to arrive...except for the sleeping Slick who resting near them. On top of the nearby tree branch, Quentin, Zeke, and Viz spotted someone heading this way...It was their target: Lady Sakuya. Her really long and beautiful hair flows through as she headed to the coordinates sent in the message.

"Target sighted. I repeat, target sighted...Get ready on my command." Quentin informs the hunters among the grass.

"Huh...She's pretty brave to come here by herself..." Viz smirks.

"She is a high level after all. Keep focus..." said Zeke

Ryx and Atomic, meanwhile, pretends to fight each other in order to lure their target. Ryx keeps blocking Atmoic's large fist, dodging one of them that was a bit too close to his face.

"Easy, Atomic..."

"Gihaha! Better keep it up, pal!" Atomic laughs while throwing another punch at Ryx. While continue fake fighting, they both heard thundering footsteps approach. Their target came into view, sword in hand.

Sakuya was ready to help a player to defeat the monster but was hesitate at the moment as she saw the player and the monster. While the monster is bigger than the player, both of them are really small...Still the monster has the black icon over his head, telling her its really a dangerous monster and since she is a high level, Sakuya can bring the monster down no problem...and perhaps asking the tiny player how did he get so small...

"Do not worry, I got this! Just stand back!" Sakuya said, ready to strike down the monster.

Ryx silently nodded and quickly gets near her sandal clad foot while Atomic gets ready to fight the giant Sylph. Before Atomic get ready to attack her, Sakuya begins casting a spell and a large fireball appears out of nowhere, heading towards the bulking hunter. Atomic skids to a stop before jumping out of the fireball's way, hitting the ground leaving the burn mark. Atomic regains his footing but not before he felt a strong pierce into his skin, causing him to grunt in pain. Sakuya smiles as she successfully hits her target, however, her eyes widen in shock when Atomic grabs her katana and pulls it away from with such amazing strength, causing the Lord of Sylph to stumble.

"Now, Ryx!" Atomic shouted.

Sakuya heard the monster talking to someone until she felt a cut on her knee, the Sylph grunts a little while kneeling. She was able to spot her attacker....It was the same player that was fighting the monster, this time he was attacking her...She soon realize this was a set up for the PKers. Sakuya quickly gets up and tries to escape but was unaware of the other hidden hunters who were about to strike her.

"Go go go!" Quentin orders them while he, Zeke, and Viz jumps off the branch with weapons in hand. the three hunters jumped into Sakuya's thick curtain of hair, blaze through the green jungle and plunge their weapons right in her neck. Sakuya wenches in pain and fends off her attackers by swatting them. The three recon from the grass emerges from the grass and launches their attack by going under her kimono, striking her tabi cover foot and upward to her leg. Sharper gets a quick glace of her panties before Petire slaps him, resuming their attack. Danny and Dr.Coon uses their flight skills to scale up the giant Sakuya while she was busy fending off the other hunter's attacks. Danny decided to attack her near her chest, which is quite predictable for a womanizer while Coon attack her face.

Sakuya felt many attacks on her body, but it didn't do much damage to her. She is now fighting mutiple PKers and there's no in sight to aid her. She quickly open her inventory to equip a backup sword, but before she could do it, the recon stooges and Ryx cut her knees again and a icon appears on under her hp bar which is not a very good sign to her: a boot with a red line. Sakuya tumbles backward landing on her but, it looks like it may be the end for the Lord of Sylphy.

With their target on the ground, the hunters regroup on the revealing bosom of Sakuya while Atomic stay by the ground, still holding her katana. Sakuya watches one of the PKer walks to the middle of her chest with his sword in hand, ready to finish off the Slyphy.

"Sorry about this, nothing personal. Just doing the NanaoCorps mission..." Quentin said, ready to knock her out.

11533222222222221.title: Mikoto Misaka

choices: The Dorm Supervisor is making a surprise room check!
115332222222222211.content:
A cold blue light engulfs the hunters as they step through the portal. The organic members feel their stomach drop out from under them as they fly through dimensions unknown on their way to their final destination. Suddenly, the floor rushes up to meet them as they are deposited onto a smooth wooden floor. Two massive beds rose up on either side of them, giving them the feel of being trapped in a canyon between two mountains.

“Beta, you idiot! You said the device was working fine! Now we’re shrunk to only a couple of inches tall!” Danny yelled at the robot, giving the non-organic hunter a swift kick only for his foot to bounce off with a clang. “The device was indeed working properly,” the robotic brain reported, as Danny hopped around on one foot in pain. “Dr. Micro did explain that we would be reduced in size.”

“Yeah Danny, clean out your ears,” huffed Petire.

“Guys, maybe we should stop taking jobs from Dr. Micro,” Ralph whined.

Suddenly, a goofy song started ringing out. Zeke facepalmed as he recognized Quentin’s bizarre ringtone, which was a silly jingle totally unsuited for a feared bounty hunter.

“Speak of the devil,” the Drangua said, pulling out his cellphone and checking the display. “It’s Dr. Micro. I’ll put it on speaker.”

“Bwahahahaha!” came Dr. Micro’s insane laugh. It sounded just as crazy coming from multiple dimensions away as it did when he was standing right next to you. “Welcome to Academy City! A place where science rules and magicians drool, my kind of place if you ask me-”

“Can it,” Zeke interrupted. “Who’s the target?”

“Full of haste, aren’t you? One wrong move in this world, and you might end up as a brain in a jar somewhere. Anyway, the target is the legendary Level 5 esper, the Ace of Tokiwadai, Mikoto Misaka! Despite her youth, she’s the number three ranked esper in-”

“Shut up,” Petire yelled. “What kind of powers does she have?”

“Try not to be shocked by this next revelation,” the mad scientist punned, “but she’s an electromaster! She can control a billion volts of electricity at a time, as well as utilize magnetism to erase credit cards, among other things, oh yeah and get free drinks from vending machines-”

“Enough,” Quentin said. “None of that information helps us unless we know what she looks like.”

“Hmm, yeah, that would help, wouldn’t it?” the insane doctor mused. “There’s a lot of dangerous people in Academy City, and messing with the wrong one could land you guys in a world of hurt, or on another world entirely.”

They hunters could hear Dr. Micro tapping away at a keyboard before a picture popped up on Quentin’s phone. The hunters crowded around to get a better look. Except for Slick, of course, who was still asleep.

The target looked… underwhelming, for a group used to staring down cybernetic dragons and demonic overlords, anyway. A young teenage girl was centered in the photo. She was dressed in a brown vest over a white dress shirt, and wore brown shorts under a black skirt. Short brown hair matched her brown eyes, and she wore a bored expression on her face.

“That’s all fine and dandy,” Danny said sarcastically, “but why are we so small? We couldn’t kill a flea at this size!”

“Hmm, yes, your size is a detriment, for sure,” Dr. Micro answered, “but Academy City has strict immigration protocols, and shrinking you down was the only way I could teleport you inside without tripping the sensors. But don’t worry about killing anyone, you only need to get a sample of her blood. There are some very powerful people who want her genetic information-”

“Hang on one sec, doc,” Petire said. “Of all places, why did you send us into someone’s bedroom? There’s hardly any hiding spots here!”

“Good observation! No wonder you’re in charge of the recon stooges – er, I mean ‘squad’. Well, you see,” the crazy man replied, “you’re currently in the Tokiwadai Dormitory, a place where espers aren’t allowed to use their powers! If your target can’t use her electricity, then you guys should have no problem subduing her, even at your reduced size. You’ll be meeting up with a guide that will help you take care of business. Oh yeah, men aren’t allowed in the dorm either, so make sure you aren’t caught by the Dorm Supervisor. That would certainly be a shocking ending, heh heh heh-”

“No more puns!” Quentin screamed in aggravation, throwing his cell phone across the room.

Suddenly, Beta’s proximity alarm sounded. “Electromagnetic field detected,” the robotic brain announced. The hunters readied their weapons and turned in unison toward the shadow that was moving under the closest bed. A young girl about their size ran toward the hunters, waving at them. She was the spitting image of the target, except she was carrying an assault rifle in her hands and was wearing a spiffy set of what looked like night-vision goggles on her head.

“Hang on guys, I got this!” Sharper yelled, eager to prove himself to his comrades. The young hunter rushed forward and tackled the girl to the ground.

“’Please get off of MISAKA, as MISAKA is not your target,’ MISAKA implores you, as you are heavy,” the girl said, robotically.

“What’s she talking about? Beta, do a genetic scan on that girl,” Quentin orders.

“Roger, Master Quentin. Scanning… complete. The young woman is a 100% genetic match to the target,” the robotic brain reported.

“The robot doesn’t lie, sweetheart,” said Zeke, walking forward with a syringe in hand. “Now, this won’t hurt, for me, anyway...”

Before he could draw some of her blood, Sharper yelped in pain as his body convulsed. Sparks leapt from his hair as he rolled off of the girl.

“Oww! She’s gotta be the target, she just shocked me!” the impulsive bounty hunter yelled.

“’You are the bounty hunters sent by Dr. Van Micro, correct?’ asks MISAKA, stating the obvious,” the girl said while rising to her feet. She still spoke in a strange, monotonous tone of voice.

“That’s right. I’m their leader, Quentin,” the Drangua said. “But if you aren’t the target, then who are you?”

“’MISAKA is a clone of Big Sister, whom you refer to as “the target.” I am also serving as the guide that Dr. Micro hired to lead you to Big Sister,’ MISAKA explains, expecting you to know this already,” the girl who apparently refers to herself as MISAKA said.

“That’s Van Micro for you,” Petire sighed. “Always long on rambling and short on details.”

“This is ridiculous,” Viz complained, rubbing his scar. “Can’t we just take a sample of this girl’s blood and be done with it?”

“’Because MISAKA is a clone of Big Sister, my own genetic material has already been compromised. A clone made from a clone will not be viable,’ MISAKA says, explaining the obvious,” the girl said, while inspecting the magazine of her assault rifle.

“This clone business is such a headache,” Danny whined. “Remember that one mission when Ralph got cloned by that mad scientist and the original got killed, so we had to make the clone believe that he was the real Ralph?”

“Hey, you guys said that was just a bad dream!” Ralph said, suddenly nervous. “Right??”

Quentin raised his hand, silencing the panicking recon stooge. Turning to MISAKA, he said, “It sounds like we’ll need to work together for this mission. But tell me, why would you want to harm your sister?”

“’If MISAKA defeats Big Sister, then she will become the strongest esper in Academy City. Then that boy will pay attention to MISAKA instead of Big Sister,’ MISAKA explains her motivation wistfully,” the girl said with a nod.

“Sibling rivalries are messed up,” Atomic roared. “Makes me glad that I’m one of a kind.”

“Thank god for that,” said Petire. “So, what’s the plan?”

MISAKA answered his question by throwing a bunch of weird frog-shaped costumes at their feet.

Zeke doffed his trademark hat. “You don’t expect me to wear that, do you?”

“’Big Sister loves Gekota. If we dress up as Gekota figures, Big Sister will be sure to pick us up. Then, we can strike,’ MISAKA says, explaining her brilliant plan,” MISAKA said, loading a round into her rifle’s underbarrel grenade launcher.

“That’s the worst plan I’ve ever heard. It’s also the best plan I’ve heard all day,” Petire griped.

“Agreed. Suit up, people,” Quentin said. Thankfully, the rubber suits fit snugly over their armor. Slick woke up long enough to slip into a costume that looked more like a set of footy pajamas before falling back asleep.

“Uh, guys?” Atomic roared. “I think mine is a size too small,” the giant hunter said. The costume couldn’t even cover one of his massive legs.

“’Do not worry. MISAKA has prepared for this kind of situation. The monster can be Pyonko,’ MISAKA says, showing off how prepared she is,” MISAKA said, while pulling out a pink mask in the shape of a cartoon frog’s face.

Atomic strapped the mask to his face. “Anyone who takes a picture won’t be returning home alive,” he roared. The feared bounty hunters looked ridiculous in their green frog costumes. Zeke put his hat back on, making him look like some kind of cowboy Gekota figure. They held their weapons at the ready.

“’Big Sister should be back from school any second,’ MISAKA says, noting the imminent sunset,” MISAKA said, her robotic voice slightly muffled by the costume.

Suddenly, they heard the creaking of floorboards in the hallway outside.
